title: ion-item-sliding
body: A sliding item contains an item that can be dragged to reveal buttons. It requires an
component as a child. All options to reveal should be placed in the
By default, the buttons are placed on the

side. This means that options are revealed when the sliding item is swiped from end to start, i.e. from right to left in LTR, but from left to right in RTL. To place them on the opposite side, so that they are revealed when swiping in the opposite direction, set the
can be used at the same time in order to reveal two different sets of options depending on the swiping direction.
By default if an icon is placed with text in the
, it will display the icon on top of the text, but the icon slot can be changed to any of the following to position it in the option.
In LTR, start is the left side of the button, and in RTL it is the right
The icon is above the text
The icon is the only content of the button
The icon is below the text
In LTR, end is the right side of the button, and in RTL it is the left
Options can be expanded to take up the full width of the item if you swipe past a certain point. This can be combined with the
event to call methods on the class.

props.name: disabled
props.docs: If true, the user cannot interact with the sliding item.

methods.name: close
methods.docs: Close the sliding item. Items can also be closed from the List.

methods.name: closeOpened
methods.docs: Close all of the sliding items in the list. Items can also be closed from the List.

methods.name: getOpenAmount
methods.docs: Get the amount the item is open in pixels.

methods.name: getSlidingRatio
methods.docs: Get the ratio of the open amount of the item compared to the width of the options. If the number returned is positive, then the options on the right side are open. If the number returned is negative, then the options on the left side are open. If the absolute value of the number is greater than 1, the item is open more than the width of the options.

docsTags.name: param
docsTags.text: side The side of the options to open. If a side is not provided, it will open the first set of options it finds within the item.

docs: A sliding item contains an item that can be dragged to reveal buttons. It requires an [item](../item) component as a child. All options to reveal should be placed in the [item options](../item-options) element.

events.docs: Emitted when the sliding position changes.
